full_summary:
**Expression of Interest - Land, Shelburne, NS**
==============================================

**Document Reference:** cb-435-41651105

**Amendment:** 1
**Publication Date:** 2024-03-25
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-04-25T22:59:00

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking to acquire a three to six-acre (1 to 1.6 Hectares) plot of vacant land in the town of Shelburne, Nova Scotia. The land must be located within a ten-kilometer radius of Exit 26 on Highway 103.

**Land Requirements:**

* Minimum of three acres and maximum of six acres in size
* Arterial road frontage (direct road access or confirmation of ability to obtain access)
* Preferably zoned commercial, institutional or industrial
* Rectangular in shape (preferably)
* Close proximity to amenities such as service stations, financial institutions and restaurants

**Additional Requirements:**

* A map showing the location of the lands
* Site plan
* Description of the current zoning
* Details of services/utilities
* Statement on the nature of the respondent's rights in the land
* Completed Phase I Site Assessment (if available)
* Completed Property Transfer Assessment Questionnaire

**Submission Process:**

Interested parties must submit their information to the RCMP by the tender closing date of April 25, 2024.

* By email: [Glenda.Mercer@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:Glenda.Mercer@rcmp-grc.gc.gc.ca)
* By mail: Glenda Mercer, Assets and Procurement, Royal Canadian Mounted Police, 80 Garland Avenue, Mailstop H-060, Dartmouth, NS, B3B OJ8

The RCMP may request additional information from respondents. Agents submitting a response must provide a letter from the owner authorizing them to do so.

**Request for Information:**

If you are the owner of a property that meets the above requirements and are interested in selling, please submit your information to the RCMP by the specified deadline.

**Contact Information:**

* Name: Glenda Mercer
* Email: [Glenda.Mercer@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:Glenda.Mercer@rcmp-grc.gc.gc.ca)
* Phone: 902-720-5372

Note: I rewrote the entry to make it concise, clear, and free of grammatical errors
